content: very easy lengthwise houndstooth scarf or larger item © 2022 judith f russell this pattern eliminates that problem of frequent color changes in houndstooth patterns by stitching lengthwise and incorporating the color changes into the fringe on the short edge of the scarf or blanket blanket it can be made as a scarf lapghan or afghan skills chain single_crochet double_crochet color change fringe creation and attachment materials one skein of yarn in two contrasting colors size 4 or smaller is best examples here are red heart soft 2 crochet hooks larger and smaller to match yarn resulting fabric should not be too loose examples here are in i hook for starting chain and h hook for fabric directions beginning chain with larger hook chain until about 2 inches from desired length the chain will stretch a bit a scarf should be about 60 - 65 inches a lapghan or baby afghan should be about 50-52 inches row 1 single_crochet in 3rd chain from hook then alternate double_crochet and single_crochet across ending with a double_crochet don t worry if you have an extra stitch since it will be covered with the fringe attach new color chain 1 and turn figure 1 figure 1 figure 2 row 2 single_crochet directly into the double_crochet stitch below the turning chain then alternate single_crochet and double_crochet across the row the single crochets go into the double_crochet from the row below the double_crochet go into the single_crochet in the row below always end with a double_crochet always end by attaching new color in th last stitch then chain 1 and turn figure 2 repeat row 3 until desired width for scarf about 6 - 7 inches lapghan or afghan sides will be slightly different with one of the colors more predominant on each side if possible end with the color with which you began you will have a fringe already from the tied off ends but you may want to add some additional fringe in either or both colors figure 3 figure 3
